page.title: 01GENERAL INFORMATION
page.content:
This area of{Essex}is countryside with a few villages and hamlets. It is undulating landscape mainly used for agriculture. The{River Chelmer}passes through and has numerous tributories. The A130 road from Chelmsford to Cambridge passes through the biggest village,{Ford End. There are several bye-roads and lanes leading to farms and houses. The fields are divided by hedges and ditches and there are numerous deciduous trees. The main land usage is for farming. Many people travel out of the area to work.
{
